unit_learning_outcomes.description: Differentiate and evaluate the professional roles within multidisciplinary teams who work with children and adults with complex health and developmental conditions, and their families, in acute and community settings.

Identify and analyse how medical and surgical procedures (e.g., head and neck surgery, craniofacial surgery, tracheostomy, laryngectomy, radiation oncology) can affect communication and swallowing in children and adults.
Identify and critically evaluate how ageing can affect communication and swallowing, and select appropriate, evidence-based management procedures for clients in aged care residential settings.
Select and apply theoretically-motivated, evidence-based speech pathology management procedures for multifaceted developmental speech and language disorders.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Before and after class learning activities including readings, small group work, development of materials shared with peers, engagement in online discussion.

assessments.description: In this assessment task, students will be provided with case information relating to children who have communication and/or swallowing disorders. They will be also be provided with clinical scenarios, and asked to develop plans relating to speech pathology intervention for these children. The assessment task will require them to integrate and synthesise case information, case data, theory, research evidence, and routine speech pathology practices in order to formulate plans.

In this assessment task, students will be provided with case information relating to adults who have communication and/or swallowing disorders. They will be also be provided with clinical scenarios, and asked to develop plans relating to speech pathology intervention for these adults. The assessment task will require them to integrate and synthesise case information, case data, theory, research evidence, and routine speech pathology practices in order to formulate plans.

data.subject_search_title: SPTH8841 - Advanced Topics in Speech Pathology

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit will consolidate and extend learning in selected areas of speech pathology practice. Special topics in child, adolescent and adult health care will be explored in consultation with researchers, and clinical specialist speech pathologists. These topics include multifaceted development disorders, complex medical conditions and surgical procedures, and ageing and residential care.
